intro: Plagiobothrys reticulatus var. rossianorum, commonly known as the Rossian woollystar, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its delicate, herbaceous structure.
